subject: RE: [junit] Re: black box or white box?
msgSnippet: ... I assume that there is a performance requirement that drove this design decision. That performance requirement should perhaps be in the tests, and not the
messageBody:
> > From: ipreussde [mailto:ilja.preuss@...]
> >
> > > > For example, for some index class, if you know it uses a linear
> > list up
> > > > to 5 items and then a hash table, choosing to test with 4 items
> > to test
> > > > the list case and also test with 5 items to test the hash table
> > case is
> > > > white box testing.

I assume that there is a performance requirement that drove this design
decision. That performance requirement should perhaps be in the tests, and
not the implementation details. Assert that retrieval in a list with 100
items takes no longer than 1 ms, whatever the numbers happen to be...

--
J. B. Rainsberger,
